reviews.text: As the name implies, the station is MUCH closer to the town centre than Colchester North is. However, the station could honestly do with some upgrades to make it feel a bit more pleasant. More ticket machines, seating and possibly bringing back the second platform to allow for a more frequent train service here as well would be of much benefit. Trains here head towards the likes of Clacton, Colchester and London.

The whole train station need an upgrade and an update. Often there's nobody there to assist or help, and even the machine (yes, one), is not working or able to provide tickets. Lack of information or possibilities to purchase Oyster card - I believe this should be included or at least one machine for Oyster cards should be available as many commute to/from London from this train station. 

In regards to the town centre, there's the essential shops and boutiques, very small and the main centre is about two streets long. For someone who lived in larger cities and towns, this would be a slight shock and become boring very quick.
A town steeped in history and culture. Lots of places to go here and lots of things to do. The perfect blend of city and country living
Beautifull View. Nice places to visit
Just enough shops, a nice walk, very historic area. Good food outlets.
